H0.text: who is mary mcleod bethune for kids. Activist

H1.text: who is mary mcleod bethune for kids. Politician

H2.text: who is mary mcleod bethune for kids. Philanthropist

H3.text: who is mary mcleod bethune for kids. Educator

A4.text: Bethune founded the National Council of Negro Women in 1935, and proceeded to establish the Aframerican Women's Journal, which was the flagship journal of the organization.

A5.text: She started a private school for African-American students which later became Bethune-Cookman University.

A6.text: The Mary McLeod Bethune Council House is a National Park Service Teaching with Historic Places lesson plan.

A7.text: Bethune's home is a historical landmark in Daytona.
